====4.2 Actor Survey====

<table border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0">
<tr><th width="175">_Actors_</th><th>_Description_</th></tr>

<tr>
   <td>Project Leader</td>
   <td>Review newly submitted errors and proposed or revised error solutions, allocate solution responsibilities to programmers, testers, and analysts.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>Programmers/Analyst</td>
   <td>Reference error documentation and submit solution proposals, error fixes, and revised solutions</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>Tester</td>
   <td>Reference error documentation, submit test reports, error and solution confirmation, and review previous test sequences</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>CIO</td>
   <td>Overseeing the deployment and information stream of the new system while monitoring how it affects business.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>Email Server</td>
   <td>Email server communicates with the system to deliver new error report notices and updates.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>Database Server</td>
   <td>Stores the error data.</td>
</tr>
</table>

====4.3 Non-Actor Survey (Other Stakeholders)====

<table border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0">
<tr><th width="175">_Stakeholder_</th><th>_Description_</th></tr>

===5.0 Constraints to be Imposed on the Solution ===

====5.1 Constraint sources Identified by the SETS team====
<table border="1" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="0">

<tr><th width="175">_Source_</th><th>_Description_</th><th>_Rationale_</th></tr>

<tr>
   <td>Operations</td>
   <td>System must be server based.</td>
   <td>Information must be accessible from a variety of locations in and out of the office.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
   <td>Communicative Technology</td>
   <td>Email must be main source of communicating error posts and other pertinent information pertaining to system results</td>     
   <td>Employees are working from computers most of the day and email has proven to be the most consistent form of communication within the company</td>
</tr>

<tr>
   <td>System</td>
   <td>The end product must be light weight, but maintaining key functionality.</td>
  <td>Employees use their computers as work stations and can not be interrupted with machine lag.</td>
</tr>
<tr>
   <td>Technological Compatibility</td>
   <td> Software must be compatible with Linux, Unix, Windows XP up to the latest version (compatible with all browsers)</td>
  <td>All employees use one of the listed operating systems within their workstation and all are needed for specific types of testing.</td>
</tr>

<tr>
   <td>System Budget</td>
   <td> The product must be developed within the company's set project budget.</td>
   <td>If the cost is too high company will attempt to develop the software themselves</td>
</tr>

<tr>
   <td>Employee Approval</td>
   <td>Employees will test the product three months into production.</td>
   <td>This product is for the worker to help improve work relations and communication. If the employees do not approve the system, the product will not be bought by the company.</td>
</tr>
</table>
